yagRqZsAnHjTR3rs4FldrQ.text: I don't quite know how I missed the redesign of this place from naff cafeteria to surprisingly decent cafe, considering how often I walk around Hyde Park and the Serpentine. Dwarfed by the monstrous Winter Wonderland, The Serpentine Bar & Kitchen comes as a nice surprise and peaceful retreat.I was extremely busy and I can't wait to come back on a regular weekend once the fun fair is gone.Excellent choice of cakes and pastries, but the pizzas looked and smelled good, too.All "stations" seem to have their own queuing and payment system which seems a bit confusing, but in the end the waiting time was OK and we even managed to find a space at a table (far too cold to braze outdoor seating).This is the latest addition to Benugo's growing domination of public spaces. Or is it just me, they seem to be popping up everywhere.

JmBr_EmxUN0pA1kLQg2RGw.text: Nothing better than a pint in a garden in Hyde Park on a lovely Sunday afternoon.  It was very crowded but we still secured a picnic table all our own, near the water.  A pint of beer and a pint of cider was £8.  It reminded me a lot of dining at the Bellagio in Las Vegas, overlooking the fountains.  It was lovely and I'd do it again but definitely an extravagance and reserved for only special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. In the garden

Jl2fq4u9hSbs0a0Usn4MvQ.text: My friend and I met for brunch in Hyde Park at the Serpentine Bar and Kitchen (serpentinebarandkitchen.…) . It's such a lovely setting and despite walking by so many times I'd never actually gone in before. We arrived just before 11am which was a good time as the place was already quite busy. I spotted a newly-vacant table by the window and went to nab it but someone else was there quicker and played the 'we've got a pram so it's easier to sit here' card, which I didn't really get to be honest  there was just as much room at the previous table, but away we went defeated. There was still room further back and we sat at a small table, furnished with condiments. Although the kitchen is not visible it's still open above the small partition they've put in front which means you do get a lovely whiff of grub when you're waiting to eat perhaps a tactic to up-sell coffees to brunches. You do have to go and order for yourself and at the prices they charge it seems a little much, service would be nicer. However, we ordered myself the eggs Florentine and my friend opted for the same without sauce or spinach (no discount for just wanting a buttered muffin and eggs I might add). The food was really nice. The eggs are creamy duck eggs and the Hollandaise was delicious (although I tried not to have too much as I was watching the calories). The tea was yummy and I got about three cups from my teapot but we did have to pay 40p for the hot water (really?!). See the breakfast menu here (serpentinebarandkitchen.…) . All in all it's a lovely setting but gets very busy with families so it's not the best location for an intimate chat. We teamed our brunch with a walk around the Serpentine in the brisk January cold, burning off some of it we hoped. I'd go again for a treat, but perhaps just for a drink. At £9 without drinks, my breakfast was a little bit of a treat but won't become a regular expenditure.

YissfqKZXlrtYpHEiMy2CQ.text: £1.50 for a can of coke... seriously?Your gelato was more reasonably priced at £2.95 for two scoops. But it was boring, lacked real flavour and I question why you feel the need to mix hazelnut and toffee crunch. That's just wrong. It was also far too melty... the end.

1nFN0wXWUGOXwPn2ER8i0A.text: After a leisurely walk around Hyde Park, the Serpentine is waiting for a snack, some wine, and to take your money. My friends and I went with the personal pizzas which ranged from around 8 to 12 pounds.  Fortunately, we realized that the pizzas were pretty large for just one person and ended up splitting them to save some money.  Like the previous review, I agree that the drinks were overpriced: sodas, wines, and beers.I give the Serpentine, three stars though because of the atmosphere.  The restaurant has a great view of the lake and park.  Inside, the different chairs are covered in pillows, center around a fireplace, and there is outdoor seating.Though one trip to the tourist trap is enough, if you happen to be in the park and want some lunch go for it.

uDCIoDMjT0WMShriz4K4lg.text: Alfresco, find a table looking out over the blue Serpentine waters through the green of the cactus and reed beds, shafts of early morning sunshine on the menu, what a treat! Presentation, quality and reasonable price of the breakfast platter excellent - coffee strong and smooth - definitely worth walking, jogging, cycling or crawling over to the Serpentine Bar & Kitchen for breakfast - recommended, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Relax, have your delicious breakfast...but... NO BATHING!    Should never swim on a full stomach
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

lagOeGEWK5u_H6WGkyUIqg.text: Wow what a place.. It has to be the busiest place I have been to. The pizza's are great but keep in mind they don't serve food between 11:30 and 12:00 (breakfast to lunch change)

P1YDlrTWlPhGQ8ykF2F0-w.text: I held a breakfast meeting here this week and it was absolute perfection: geese on the lake, decent coffee, and tasty breakfasts to suit all tastes, from fried full English to fruit and granola. At 9 am it was almost empty, leaving us to enjoy the view, the music, the food and our work. We might make it a regular meeting place, if we can convince them to share the password for their Wi-Fi network.

XRKXshPVZDGqNX6novJR_g.text: The restaurant next to the Serpentine lake and river in Hyde Park has just reopened (April 09) and is already an amazing success, just by looking at the long queues of customers waiting to order their food and drinks. The place has been totally redesigned with strong inspiration from gastro-pub food and decor with a fantastic view on the lake. There is both a large restaurant with large open windows that bring plenty of light and a large terrasse under the trees perfect for a sunny day (there are some) in the Park. It is huge (300 seats including outdoor) but doesnt feel so huge). The menu changes for breakfast (8-12am), lunch (12-3) and dinner (5-8pm). We had breakfast there with a choice of classic eggs, bacon, sausages etc. plus pancakes, croissant, muffins, basically everything one expect from a UK/US style breakfast. Food is served quite fast (once you have managed to order) on the nice wooden tables inside the restaurant. There is also an area to seat down and read in comfie chairs, with darker walls and pictures hanging on the walls, cool contrast with the rest. I uploaded a pix of the kitchen. The BIG drawback is that the food ordering system is so badly organised that it almost spoiled our breakfast but I am sure it drove many meny people mad. There is basically no clear signage of how to queue at the bar and staff is totally lost leading to very long queues forming very fast. Super frustrating, the managers must know about this and I hope their process will be redesigned soon. Until they sort this out it will remain a 3-star place but this has clear 5-star potential once this is sorted, it should be great at any time, from early breakfasts to an early dinner facing the beautiful sunset one can catch from that place. Note that this is very child friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

TL5bNSJOTOOMh5owkptt5Q.text: I have known this restaurant for about 30 years and it has changed so often during this time. However, it always was a nice place to have drink or snak in a nice atmosphere.Breakfast can be enjoyed in a very relaxed and silent atmosphere. In principal, the food ist good. However, it was not possible to have an ordinary toast (only toasted Italian ciabattabread was available). Anyway, I prefer this location and food  to the usual breakfasts in hotels.

BlP-U-REzLsWpwAtSTCEMQ.text: Let's start with the good - nice park restaurant with waterside views. It's in the middle of Hyde park so there isn't the noise of cars and we came early so it was quite peaceful and quiet.We arrived around 11:30am and it was fairly empty. Only a bunch of moms with prams and their kids. We sat outside and wanted to order breakfast. (Their menu says breakfast served until 12p, last call 11:30a). We were then told we were too late for breakfast. It was exactly 11:30a on my watch. All we wanted were salmon and eggs and we were told we were too late!  After a lot of debate, we were finally allowed to order from the breakfast menu.Then, another one of our party wanted to order from the lunch menu. It was 11.45a and the bar (where you pay) said I had to wait until 12p to order!  I said why can't you just take my order and give me the food when the kitchen re-opens? (What an inefficient kitchen that takes so long to transition from Bfast to Lunch!) they said they can't even take my order because that's what the chef says. It wasn't even a limitation on their systems, they just simply wouldn't take the lunch order before 12p!  Unreal, especially with a queue forming behind me. I'm a Yank but have been here for 8.5 years so I've learned to be patient about British inefficiencies but this is nuts. Especially on a sunny summer weekend!  Just take the order and I'll be happy to wait!  Needless to say I wasn't the only one shocked at this. There were a few behind me pretty irritated about this "policy" as well. FYI there is no wifi here as well. If I come back here I'll make sure to come well before the transition time. The food is ok, wouldn't say it's the best, but the views are nice and it's a calming environment if you head over before the rush!

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Prosciutto pizza 12.75

xxD6xQbXCO4aZwmDvrQMEg.text: Not the crappy park food stand you may think it is.We were pleasantly surprised that this was a great little cafe with many options:  hot breakfast, baguette sandwiches, coffee, fresh juice, etc.  The food was great and the atmosphere was fantastic.  It was filled with people from all over the world.  Tourists on bikes, locals on bikes, locals jogging, tourists walking, kids, adults, etc.  The water makes for a nice view.Don't half step.  Be aware of the birds outside...don't leave that food unattended.

STIpYrSNR8-SteDHWwXiwg.text: The serpentine bar and kitchen is set up where you pick a table with a number on it, sit down and review the menu, then go up and order telling them your table number and they bring the food to you. It was a rainy day in Hyde park, and so the restaurant was not very busy at all. My husband and I sat and looked through the menu, decided on the veggie pizza. He went up to order while I enjoyed the views. As soon as my husband got up, a very rude worker came up to me and stated rudely."You can't just sit here, you have to be eating." I looked up and said"I am going to be eating."The worker demanded to me "let me see your receipt."To which I responded, "I don't have one yet, my husband is in line ordering right now". And I pointed to my husband in line. She glared at me and thought a moment and she said "what is he ordering?"I was really taken aback and irritated. I asked her "Does it matter? Do you need me to go get him to prove he's in line and we are ordering food?"She said "I just need to know what your ordering""Pizza". I said. She made an irritated noise and walked away.I watched this worker the rest of the time I was there and she did not approach any other table or person to question them the way she questioned me.While I realize people probably go in there often and have no plans to order and are trying to rest or enjoy the view-- I think there are better and less rude ways to police this. I got up to leave because I don't need to give business to a place that treats people so rudely, but my husband had finished ordering.Our pizza came out and it was quite delicious. Despite the food being great and the view unforgettable, the way I was treated is not acceptable and we will not be back.

UKCXK8TjP168oPNqzrCb7w.text: I am surprised no one has given this place a 5 star rating yet! I cannot think of a better place to go in London than Serpentine on a beautiful summer evening! It has the perfect ingredient to have a great time - Located in the center of lush green Hyde Park, brilliant outdoor seating area by the serpentine river, the most beautiful place to sit and watch the sun set, great pizza, Pimms Pitchers and great crowd! I mean what else can one possibly ask for from a restaurant? I have been here on several occasions and also hosted my birthday party here last year and it is always a pleasure coming back here. In my last visit yesterday when the sun finally decided to shine on London after a long wait, Serpentine was packed and yet the service was so fast and the spicy pepperoni pizza couldn't taste any better along with my Pimm's Pitcher! The price is very decent for its location and quality, I mean come on its Hyde Park are you expecting brick lane price here?Verdict: I am in love with this place and will continue to be till it stands tall and beautiful in the middle of Hyde Park! P.S Do try their cakes, they are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Bakewell cake
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

9G2v7lF-un5MmJxPJmY-Yg.text: Pleasantly surprised by the freshness of the pre packed baguette with salmon and cucumber. Enough salmon to actually call it a salmon baguette (guess you know what I mean). The people at the pay desk were a bit stressed out even though it wasn't busy and weren't very friendly, save one. Sitting outside overlooking the lake only makes it sandwich better. And the strawberries and cream were a right treat!On my way from the outside terrace back to the Underground I had a quick glance at the pizzas on other people's plates, didn't look so nice, but we all know looks can be deceiving so I leave it up to you to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Strawberries and cream, perfect for a treat in the park!

WAtUtx64F8ckZgL6miXpMg.text: Lovely place. Amazing view of the serpentine lake. The food is very tasty, the bread used for the sandwiches is soft. Very good. Affordable prices. Gotta try. They have a good selection of cakes and cookies too. Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The menu
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Soup of the day. Tasty. 5
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

A156Ybu6hX5oEm_qf3ZtkA.text: Location and architecture is great. It is a shame however that they stop serving lunch at a certain time so you can if you time things wrong miss out and just get let with drinks and desserts as was the case with me. This type of timed service does not work in such a location where people just walk in at anytime from the park. I went went it was want out and took time to cool down so not sure how comfortable it will be when the temperature gets really warm. So be warned. Unless you like to eat in an oven!I would like to go again when the main lunch or dinner is being served however. I ate a chelate tart which was nice but a bit too rich for me to finish fully.

ax7n-t9J4LLWKoRYJq3gfQ.text: I was visiting London as a tourist with my mother, and we were trying to find a place to eat ind Hyde Park. We walked by Serpentine Bar & Kitchen, which looked delicious and was filled with people, so we went in to try their food. It was a huge place with a grand terrace with a great view on a sunny day, and we ordered a pizza and a salad. Yummi! Wonderful wonderful pizza that you can definitely taste is made freshly in the kitchen, and the salad was great too! Great dressing and fresh vegetables. The pizza had a thick crust, and though I prefer it thin, the bread was so well baked and delicious that this was totally OK. Wonderful experience! Can only recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Great pizza and fresh salad on the terrace

iJBJsZmZIinR9mZ1J0b58A.text: It's a place you find in the middle of Hyde Park, just besides the lake. For me the best is the environment. The food is quite ok, though quite limited in options. You will get the mix of pizza with some texmex food. You have ton first take a seat, write down the table number and then go to order. They will give you first the drinks and later the waiter will deliver all main courses directly tenuous table

KKllCdD7ZcgI8dKirOf_4g.text: Sitting along Serpentine Lake, enjoying a cool drink (on a warm day) or a coffee (on a cold day) is just the ticket for me.  I absolutely love this place, and it's also a great spot to watch the sunset.Tip: be sure to grab a table and its number before you place your order, to save you a lot of hassle and heartache.

jADhSIxzY1y7-Qj5bwQbdQ.text: Fairly bog-standard trying-to-be-something-else place. You go here if you want a coffee or a slice of cake in the park. Or dinner, I suppose.But it's really best avoided.The coffee is OK at best. (Also, for some reason a flat white is cheaper than an Americano, despite the extra work that goes into it)They've an ill-though-out queueing system so they've got to tell everyone where to queue; this overworks the service folk so much they can't offer good service, and this results as at best mediocre food and service. Also, all too often, cold coffee. Misheard orders. I hear the cakes are nice, though. And they do have the bit where you can sit and look at the Serpentine.

ISOWKCjbwvcF8pqaPDx5yg.text: I think the menu prices have been jacked up considerably high, considering you eat at picnic table.  Last I remember you could do that for free!I felt the lettuce leaves in the Caesar were too large to fit in most peoples mouths, which made eating the salad less enjoyable, than it could have been.

qr1pnFd_-aAbugEqJDiIug.text: I can't say that this cafe has the best food ever, but the view is certainly what keeps people coming back. I came here for a little weekend pick-me-up with a nice lunch within the serene atmosphere of Hyde Park. I ordered the fish finger buttie, chips, and a florentine for dessert. Twas all yummy, but nothing spectacular. Like I said, I mostly visited for the view of the Serpentine and the park. The outdoor seating also allows for a great people watching ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fish finger buttie, chips, and the perfect view!

l_uAw0K2lkOsyVJATcnwsA.text: Serpentine Bar & Kitchen is located in the heart of the beautiful Hyde Park right next to the lake. The view from the restaurant, especially from the large terrace area, is quite heavenly. An oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of hectic London. And even though the restaurant can get pretty crowded and loud, the atmosphere is quite nice and there are plenty of tables. Outside seating is definitely the way to go if it's not too cold. The menu consists of pretty basic pub food, but they put up daily specials which is great! I had the soup of the day, which was a potato and broccoli soup. It wasn't anything to rave about to be honest, it was just ok. What was a big negative thought was the fact that the soup was brought to me absolutely scolding hot and it was literally impossible to eat for at least 15 minutes... The wait staff was super fast and efficient but a bit rude. As a conclusion I would give the food and service 3 stars but the location is 5 stars - therefore my review is a 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

JGxlhSGTVMpikb4WAa95lw.text: The drinks are absurdly overpriced and small. The guy at the counter was very slow and inattentive. He spent more time flirting than helping customers.

tCJOjT1YAmztmKKD5fw0-A.text: We happened upon this while walking through the park. The sun was out and we enjoyed a few drinks. Had a great time.

Cy_sycFm3coV3BLrIMCADA.text: Ridiculously overpriced.Had better food on easyJet.Avoid here, and bring a sandwich from Tesco and you'll have a much better day!

FXNVizzgs9I8rAc0N3Oc8w.text: Was in Hyde Park on the opening Sunday of the Olympics as they were getting the park ready for the Triathlon. The plan had been to buy sandwiches for the kids and to have a picnic, however, the heavens opened and we literally stumbled onto this place having no idea that it was there.The food was pretty good indeed. We kept it simple and had burgers and pizzas and they were lovely. A lot of people have made a big deal of it being expensive but three burgers, one kids pizza, two coffees, a coke and an OJ was £52.00. I didn't think that was too bad. And we got to eat it with a lovely view of the lake just as the worst of the weather rolled by.Recommended.

rKqEeCPXVU04t82nN0KCPg.text: This place is ok. If you want to take some out-of-towners to enjoy Hyde Park it's a good spot. The food is decent, but a little overpriced. It might deserve 4 stars because of the location. I got a table right by the water and you have some beautiful views on a nice day. I would go back on a sunny summer day to enjoy a day in the park... but there was nothing memorable about the food.

U0nfA3naV4ouQ3gnP1DjFQ.text: Great location with surprisingly good food.  I didn't have high expectations for this place assuming it was a normal tourist trap/concession stand.  If the weather is nice, sitting outside is amazing.  Even sitting inside looking out through the glass is pretty great.Baby Friendly 5 starsKid Friendly 5 starsCauliflower steak-fantastic.  This was one of the best/healthiest things I had.   Great size portion!Veggie burger-  Good.  Tasted good, but I was surprised it didn't come with chips.Pizza-tastyMany people bring babies and children here, and with good reason!  It's so fun for them to be in the park, and this is a great place to eat!

8SlsUKLeVHlidA9JioPdbA.text: After walking Hyde Park we needed a rest so we stopped in here for ice cream. The girl refused to give us half of one flavor and half of another. We settled on Rocky Road and it was far too sweet--never mind she gave us barely a scoop. On the plus side, this place has an amazing view and lots and lots of seats, plus restrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

6lQIvx8HNlhwG3ZDk0gGqQ.text: Bitchy lady at the counter Oct 22 2:02pm. She could have been nicer to let us know we need to get a table number before we order our food. She lacked customer service and was irritated that we don't k ow what we're doing. Sorry but we're visiting from another country. This is a post for all those visiting Hyde Park. Maybe not for Londoners.

WZQPTAF2F9lTdb-Wz1GpkQ.text: Shucks kids I'm updating a review in London for the 2nd time! This is weird. I feel weird.Anywaaaayyyyy Serpentine is fantastic. Their pizzas are bangin' and you order food at the front. If you want takeaway they've got a lovely variety of sandwiches for your convenience. But seriously get the pizza. It's bangin'. That's such a weird word.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sandwich
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Margarita

T5-K6xsQc6aCvAFEkoZfSw.text: Nice environment to relax and enjoy a good meal by the lake in Hyde Park. Tried the black bean and quinoa veggie burger - the patty was really delicious!! The buns were also nicely toasted and had a thin layer of spread that paired really well with the patty.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Black bean and veggie quinoa burger

Q2OGf1W1UgXTdDjmINOgdQ.text: This place was really a nice environment to spend a summer day. The selections were varied and seemed fresh. The layout was really nice and not too crowded considering it was a Saturday in the summer.  There were selections for the kids and coffee for tired adults. The prices were not at all out of line with what one expects from London. Hyde park makes a wonderful background for this simple fast casual restaurant.I look forward to returning to Serpentine on my next visit to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Nice open location on the water. Surprisingly not too crowded for a summer Saturday.
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. More lake.
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Find a seat , place your order at the counter then food is delivered by the table number on the corner. So note yours before you go order.

PsPDzpvjJKSZY9nobPIXag.text: The food here is quite average. BUT if it's sunny outside and you can get a seat near the lake you can have a royal lunch! I recommend it during the summertime.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

MR-KQofjwz4pgUDb17tNiw.text: A nice surpriseOn this hot day we did spend a bunch of hours in Hyde Park. Naturally we got hungry after a while and this place was closest to us.Location couldn't be better, with great views of The Serpentine (at least outside). There is a good number of seats outside and a lot more inside. We travelled with our dog, so an outdoor seat was our choice (no dogs inside - but why sit inside anyways).It was really packed and no seats availabe. The waitrees helped us looking for table, which was nice. We kept looking when she came back after a while pointing us to an available table. That was really nice, especially given how busy it was that day. Kudos to the staff!We ordered a pint, a summer berries cider and a Rucola / Prosciutto Pizza. Service again was friendly and pretty fast too.Drinks were nice and cold and - for London - fairly priced. The Pizza was a good choice, good flavours and fresh ingredients. Nice twist with the Rucola on top. We didn't expect much from this Restaurant. But we were positively surprised by the really nice staff and the food quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. nice location
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Prosciuotto and Rucola Pizza

0fl2OaIjxuQHacYLXzMtrg.text: Extremely busy restaurant but T least they got enough staff to keep the turn over quick and tidy!We got a chicken pizza and a prawn/avocado salad.In summary, chicken pizza lacked chicken, and the avocado salad had 2 visible pieces of avocados that was about a tea spoon size.Flavour was good, but when you basically didn't get what you ordered, you can't really give a good score.Yes it was a tat pricy too.At least the view of nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

qgp_rOCnVW0RP-NmFqHEaw.text: Beautiful location for a restaurant! It was right in the middle of the park and the view of Buckingham Palace. They had a bunch of authentic English breakfast. I got to try the breakfast beans. Also there was a really cute set up of pastries that you can pick from on your own before you go to pay. I definitely took advantage of the fact it was over looking a lovely pond with geese and swans.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Amazing variety of pasties and fruits!
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast in london ! With Iced Coffee

EZ3JHh_NpSqEw9nI7a5Ong.text: I must  come to this place  when I visit  London, Especially  for beackfast very nice view.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Relaxing

kgHp9okIyiCQ9QL0Gy7tuw.text: On the eve of Queen Elizabeth II's 90th birthday, I found myself enjoying a romantic second date in the picturesque, centuries old, Hyde Park. After my barrel-o-laughs Brazilian beau and I spent a good amount of time soaking up vitamin D from an uncharacteristically sunny day, we set out on an excursion to diffuse our hunger pains. Tucked away in the rolling green hillside was none other than Serpentine Bar and Kitchen. Instantly familiar with the site, my guy informed me that he'd once visited Serpentine with his mom. Nearly faint from starvation, we decided to dine in. I was initially impressed with the overall structure of the building. The inconspicuous architectural design, which almost appears to have been chiseled from the lakeside by process of mechanical erosion, can best be described as an aesthetically pleasing contemporary chameleon. Spacious enough to accommodate hundreds of visitors, Serpentine offers 360 degree views of Hyde Park for indoor diners. Lunch al fresco immerses guests in a sea of bluebells, as well as a variety of trademark British foliage and landscapes.After placing our orders, my guy and I waited for our server at table number 3. (Tables are numbered, which reduces confusion for patrons and staff alike) I was satisfied with my choice of thin crust vegetable pizza with rosemary fries. I went out on a limb and decided to wash everything down with my very first ginger beer. While recovering from Fentimans unrelenting roundhouse kick, I sat and enjoyed my beau savour every morsel of his open faced steak sandwich and more than a few of my rosemary fries. Overall, Id highly recommend a meal at Serpentine to anyone who finds themselves in Hyde park in the near or distant future.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Baby's steak sandwich.
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The delicious veggie pizza.
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fentimans ginger beer REALLY has a kick... proceed with headgear!

MZQd8mUoMT6W1ze7hlvJqg.text: Perhaps because it has the best outdoor patio to enjoy the Serpentine in Hyde Park, the food here is relatively expensive and mediocre. While I would recommend grabbing some drinks or coffee with friends or by yourself to enjoy the beautiful scenery in this restaurant patio, I would not recommend getting a full meal here. It's simply not worth the high price even by London standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Egg benedict

8S6kB9w4NLimKOqaNgDzCQ.text: Perfect way to sit by the water in Hyde Park on a summer evening with a light bite to eat.Not much in terms of food, the pizzas and the salad are nice, but it doesn't matter, because you're there to only people watch, enjoy a light and meal and drink in the sights and sounds of a wonderful London summer evening...there's something blissful about sitting casually in Hyde Park, especially in July. And yes, now you know why all those poets went crazy writing their ode to this place...!Coming back to Serpentine Bar and Kitchen - you order at the counter, they give you a token and get your food to the table. It's all pretty much self service & easy.

xZ8ifbdXJleGrwGE4fNiOQ.text: Stopped in for a drink while exploring London and seeing all the touristy spots. Stopped in and had a sangria while sitting on the water. Great place to stop and rest.

nTfPO1vOUB3a70jCZGaK9g.text: Great prices, large portions, what else can you want..oh and the food is good. You need to walk up to the bar to order but a waiter will bring it to the table for you.

Ra1ItFKCyJFD8kQnLFCjKg.text: amazing food with a lovely view! we ordered fish & chips - always very British ;) - & the soup of the day (carrot/squash), olives and bread. the soup was very creamy and tasty, the olives fresh and combined with cheese. the bread was fresh and super yammi! my grandma is convinced that she just had the best fish & chips ever! you pay a little bit more but the service is brilliant and the location/ food is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

S9zGAP3TNsXJp4XHpxpItQ.text: I was walking at Hyde park .. It start raining i decided to enter this store .. To have a warm latte and cake .. It's a nice place sit down and watching an amazing view ..this store is serving hot drinks, cake , pizza so you can visit the anytime you wish (breakfast , afternoon tea , takeaway and also dinner ) pizza is the famous thing at this store ,staff are friendly and lovely

photos.caption: Photo of Serpentine Bar & Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

rc0X0d6dffCxinHPuEXbLQ.text: Again another coffee and cake at Serpentine Bar. I will always moan about the price of a slice and cake and the coffee but it really it a fabulous place to sit and watch the world go by. We recently popped in on a cold crisp and sunny day and brave the outdoor benches to watch the sun go down. Needless to say we needed our coffees (again I got a mocha which was good) and shared a slice of carrot cake which was really good. Moist, good flavour, good amount of cream cheese icing but a little burnt at the very bottom.

yBu6WNqC3PWzY8bSZSmU-g.text: A great spot with outdoor seating on the lake in Hyde Park. We didn't order food, only had drinks, but enjoyed the scenery, people watching, and casual atmosphere with a good sunset to boot. Prices were reasonable. I'd definitely come back.
